This board fucking blows. I want my RP back.

Riot: We don't need categories
Us: ok, so we have to filter through this like reddit? Ohh wait, reddit has a filter do you plan on using a filter to, so we can atleast do a proper grouping?
Riot: We don't need no groups
Us: ok, so I do you plan on giving us Free RP for the pain in the ass you created?
Riot: We don't need to give no RP
Us: ok, so we love the game, but you're starting to abuse us.
Riot: We don't abuse.
Us: This freaking sucks.
Riot: Sucks or not, you'll still pay us. 
Us: How far will you go?
Riot: Until we stop making money.
Us: I need a shower, I think I just got shit on.
There is considerable irony in this being the most upvoted comment.
that isn't irony
This shit is stupid. Players clearly told Rito we didn't want this. They forced us into it anyway.

You have to remember that the forum community only makes up a tiny portion of the LoL community. So even though it feels like everybody on the forums hates the new boards, most of the players who don't use the forums actually like the change.

/sarcasm

The sad thing is, they would actually use this logic to debate it. Just add it to the list of "We know what you want more than you do" things that Rito has done. This time, however, I cannot even see their reasoning behind it.
No one does, since when does Rito do things people like?
Yeah, these forums are trash.  20 seconds in and I already have a headache.

I've seen this stated a lot and had glanced at this forum before and left with a shrug. (I figured I'd have an immediate problem since I'm susceptible to computer related headaches.) Apparently I was spending less than a minute on here because after this one thread I have a headache and strained eyes myself. I guess my occasional bored lurking is at an end.

Thanks riot, you guys are all around amazing at fucking up yet staying the course and retaining that engorged ego. Keep it up.
I don't understand why Riot is pushing is on us. Reddit is already a thing, and I don't go to it for a reason. Now the official forums are gone too. FMl.

It's a thing because, a couple of years ago, some Rioters went to discuss League on Reddit.  Being developers, they instantly found their posts getting lots and lots of upvotes.  They found this made them feel good and gave them confidence, so they kept going, and they told their Rioter friends.  They decided that Reddit was such a magical place where everyone loved everything they said that they would copy it and bring it here, forcefeeding it to the forum population that didn't love everything they said.
It feels so hollow
Use to love reading the forums everyday but now.. I just don't understand why they would use this format. The main reason i don't go to reddit is because it looks like this.

My biggest issue with the new "boards" is that everything seems so homogeneous.  It is really difficult to visually distinguish different things and to navigate around because it is all so flat and similarly-colored.  The interface feels like a big step backward, or like unfinished or something.  It shouldn't be simplistic the way Reddit is.  

Reddit is a completely different thing, and even there the League of Legends Reddit has a heavily customized interface.  At least the /r/LeagueofLegends interface is "good enough".  I really doubt I'll be using "boards" much at all :-\
